intro: Moldenhawera papillanthera, commonly known as the papillate bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its unique papillate (bumpy) structure on its petals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
